There are also some papers by Nolfi, Parisi, Floreano and the like (as well=

as others) that apply back propagation to the networks during trials and
e=
volve them across time...but that was pre-NEAT (or, at least, not done in
N=
EAT).

> In most experiments, the individual ANNs in=
 NEAT do not learn.
> Instead, learning happens over the course of generati=
ons through
> evolution.  In other words, improvements happen from one ANN =
through
> its descendents. 
> 
> On the other hand, there are experiments w=
ith "adaptive synapses"
> where the weights of connection can change over t=
he course of a
> network's lifetime through local learning rules, for examp=
le in our
> paper here:
> 
> http://nn.cs.utexas.edu/keyword?stanley:cec03
=
> 
> ken
